title: Wall Street Journal fonts
content:
Can anyone help me identify the serif and sans serif fonts used in the Wall Street Journal? (The image is wide, so you may need to scroll over to the right to see the sans serif sample.) Any help will be greatly appreciated. Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20111221030452im_/http:/typophile.com/files/wsj_3750.jpg)
author: lhegyi

comments.content:
The serif is Escrow, from Font Bureau.

[http://fontbureau.com/fonts/Escrow](http://web.archive.org/web/20111221030452/http:/fontbureau.com/fonts/Escrow "http://fontbureau.com/fonts/Escrow")
Thank you for your quick reply!

Escrow is used for the headline serif, but I believe the text serif is Exchange from Hoefler & Frere-Jones. See [this article](http://web.archive.org/web/20111221030452/http:/www.typography.com/about/clients.php) about clients.

- Mike Yanega

More info on Exchange [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20111221030452/http:/new.typographica.org/2007/typeface-reviews/exchange). And the sans is Hoefler & Frere-Jones' Retina and Retina Display (agate version [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20111221030452/http:/designarchives.aiga.org/index.html?s1=2%7Cs2=1%7Ceid=440)).

P.S. For some more info on the extraordinary Exchange and Retina, check out [this presentation audio recording](http://web.archive.org/web/20111221030452/http:/typography.com/ask/showBlog.php?blogID=192).
